qas.question: What is used to produce the metal zinc?
What is froth flotation used for?
What is the first step in zinc metal production?
What percentage of the ore concentrate is zinc?
What is used to eliminate the metal zinc?
What is froth flotation no longer used for?
What is the only step in zinc metal production?
What percentage of the s'more concentrate is zinc?

context:
Zinc metal is produced using <a0_0><b4_0>extractive metallurgy<b4_0/>.<a0_0/> After <a2_0><b6_0>grinding the ore<b6_0/><a2_0/>, froth flotation, which selectively separates minerals from gangue by taking advantage of differences in their hydrophobicity, is used to <a1_0><b5_0>get an ore concentrate<b5_0/><a1_0/>. This concentrate consists of about <a3_0><b7_0>50%<b7_0/><a3_0/> zinc with the rest being sulfur (32%), iron (13%), and SiO
2 (5%). The composition of this is normally zinc sulfide (80% to 85%), iron sulfide (7.0% to 12%), lead sulfide (3.0% to 5.0%) silica (2.5% to 3.5%), and cadmium sulfide (0.35% to 0.41%).
